task.title: Staging and committing changes
task.shortdesc: keeps track of all the changes you make to the content of your local repository. You can use the view to stage and commit your updates to the local repository.

step.cmd: In the Unstaged files area, choose the changes that you want to stage by performing one of the following actions:

choices.choice: Stage all the listed files by clicking Stage All.
Selectively stage one or more files by selecting the file or files and clicking Stage Selected.

step.cmd: In the Commit message area, perform one of the following actions:

choices.choice: Enter a new commit message in the text box.
Select a previously used commit from the drop-down list.

result.p: The numbered indicator on the Push icon is incremented and you can now publish your commit in the remote repository.
